info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:25PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clackamas and southwestern Multnomah Counties through 500 PM PDT... At 424 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milwaukie and Sellwood, or over Southeast Portland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portland Downtown, Portland, Gresham, Milwaukie, Troutdale, Powellhurst-Centennial, Hazelwood, Oatfield, Clackamas, Happy Valley, Damascus, Lloyd Center, Mt Tabor, Rockwood, Rocky Butte, Sellwood and Sunnyside. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 296 and 302. Interstate 205 between mile markers 14 and 22. Interstate 84 between mile markers 1 and 6. U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
